info.name: CyberVision
info.description:
Getting Started  
The main way to visualize and use the data analyzed by the sensors is to use  
Cisco Cyber Vision webapp offering a map for visualization, a timeline for  
events inspection and a significant number of other features.  
The other way, explained in this document, is to use the Cisco Cyber Vision  
API. In this document, CCV refers to Cisco Cyber Vision.  
The API exposes the same data than the data used by the Cisco Cyber Vision  
webapp through an HTTP protocol, a REST API, to allow the creation of thirdparty clients, scripts and automation

So, be careful when using this endpoint with live data endpoints.

item.name: Notify the system that we query the dashboard widgets.

request.description: This is useful for increasing the refresh priority of the cached data used by all widgets.

item.name: Metrics only if we are connected on local center or standalone.

query.description: enrolled local center id for which we want the metrics
number of centers sent in payload

request.description:
Metrics and top centers if we are connected on global center filter by enrolled local center in params
Warning: this endpoint is cached. This means that the returned data is not necessarily the latest.
The cache is automatically updated, but can also be updated at will thanks to POST /dashboard/{widget_id}/refresh.
More over, we can notify we are using this data with POST /dashboard/ping, and then increase its refresh priority.

query.description: enrolled local center ids for which we want the metrics

item.name: Parameters
List of one or many parameter(s) according to a pattern.

query.description: (Required) pattern that will be used for research

request.description: This endpoint is a mean of updating and retrieving parameters in the database in the form of keys and values.
This endpoint is a mean of storing and retrieving parameters in the database in the form of keys and values.

item.name: List of one or many parameter(s) according to a key.

variable.description: (Required) key that will be used for research

item.description: Routes to access the application parameters such as security options and allow to manage custom parameters.

item.name: PcapReplays
Upload a new PCAP file. This endpoint uses the **TUS protocol**. Trailing slash is mandatory.
Get TUS options. This endpoint uses the **TUS protocol**. Trailing slash is mandatory.
Push data to a file. This endpoint uses the **TUS protocol**.

variable.description: (Required) ID given by the POST endpoint in the Location header (uuid without dashes)

item.name: Push data to a file. This endpoint uses the **TUS protocol**.

variable.description: (Required) ID given by the POST endpoint in the Location header (uuid without dashes)

item.description: Routes to retrieve information about pcap files replayed.

        "severityIgnoreDifference": "<integer>",
        "severityNackDifference": "<integer>"
    },

    "scanPeriod": "<long>",
    "severityAckDifference": "<integer>",
    "severityDeleteElement": "<integer>",
    "severityDifferenceDetected": "<integer>",
    "severityIgnoreDifference": "<integer>",
    "severityNackDifference": "<integer>"
}
